message.content:
A stopwatch is a timepiece used to measure the elapsed time of an event. 
It typically has a circular shape with buttons to start, stop, and reset the timer. 
The color of a stopwatch varies, but it's commonly black or silver. 
Some stopwatches have textured grips on the sides to aid in holding and operating the device. 
Stopwatches can be found in various settings, including sports events, track races, and scientific experiments. 
They are often used by athletes, coaches, and referees to measure performance or determine winners. 
The visual characteristics of a stopwatch include clear markings for time, a digital or analog display, and accurate timing mechanisms.
